item.title: Castell Coch in World War II
item.dc:creator: Jack Davies
item.description:
The history of Castell Coch in World War II was, and still is, a bit of a mystery. I spoke to a volunteer in the castle recently and she mentioned that they knew very little about this period of its history. I asked some local residents who know lots about the village and they didn’t ...

Read more

item.title: Cadw Turns 40
item.dc:creator: Jack Davies
item.description:
The 40th anniversary of Cadw has already been covered in the news earlier this month. The BBC article, “From castles to loos – protecting Wales’ history” is well worth a read. Rather than repeat this information, I thought I’d look through my collection for items related to Cadw, share some stories I’ve published about them ...

Read more

item.title: Stereoview of Castell Coch
item.dc:creator: Jack Davies
item.description:
I recently found this example of a stereoview featuring Castell Coch. This type of photo is also called a stereographic card or stereogram. A stereoview consists of two photos that, when viewed with a device called a stereoscope, creates a three-dimensional effect. Stereoscopes This antique stereoscope was popular in the 19th century. It’s a “Holmes ...

Read more

item.title: Postcards of Castell Coch – Part 9
item.dc:creator: Jack Davies
item.description:
In this instalment of Postcards of Castell Coch I investigate a 1908 card from a rare Cardiff publisher. Researching this postcard sent me down a rabbit hole investigating the history of a small Cardiff business that was established in 1880 and expanded into the early 1900s. I spent hours looking through decades of adverts in ...

Read more

item.title: Castell Coch on Screen – Part 2
item.dc:creator: Jack Davies
item.description:
Welcome to another collection of appearances by Castell Coch on our television and movie screens. The Black Knight is well known as it was a big film in the 1950s. Knightmare was very popular kids TV show that I remember watching. She Fell Among Thieves is a bit more obscure but features an interesting set. ...

Read more

item.title: Fatal Accident at Castell Coch
item.dc:creator: Jack Davies
item.description:
Scaffolding is being erected on the Well Tower at Castell Coch for some upcoming conservation work. I happened to find a related story that happened 145 years ago this month when the castle was being reconstructed. The South Wales Daily News reported on Friday 18th July 1879 that George Maidment had died in a tragic ...

Read more

item.title: Preserving Castell Coch
item.dc:creator: Jack Davies
item.description:
Cadw have announced an extensive conservation project to remove moisture from the Well Tower at Castell Coch. The damp is causing significant damage to the intricate decorations and fabric of the building. The work is scheduled to take two years, beginning in spring 2024. Cadw noted, “This phase of work in 2024 will not affect ...

Read more

item.title: Photos of Castell Coch – Part 1
item.dc:creator: Jack Davies
item.description:
I don’t post that many of my own photos on the website. I share them regularly on Instagram but I’ve never had a dedicated series on the blog. I’ve started taking my camera out a bit more often so I’m going to post a collection every now and again. I took this shot of the ...

item.title: Colourising Castell Coch – Part 1
item.dc:creator: Jack Davies
item.description:
I’ve already featured a series of postcards that used a colourisation process to add colour to black and white photos. There are several colourised photos in my postcard collection and I’ve attempted to recreate the process using modern digital tools. Red or Blue? These cards are a perfect example of how colourisation produces very different ...

Read more

item.title: Lady Bute – Part 1
item.dc:creator: Jack Davies
item.description:
Lady Gwendolen Mary Anne Stuart (Fitzalan-Howard) played a significant part in the development of Castell Coch. Gwendolen Fitzalan-Howard (1854 – 1932) was the daughter of The 1st Baron Howard of Glossop and granddaughter of The 13th Duke of Norfolk. She was engaged to John Crichton-Stuart, 3rd Marquess of Bute in February 1872 and the couple ...

Read more
